results.title: Russia Spreads False Claims About Ukraine to Discredit POW Exchange Process
results.summary: Ukrainska Pravda reports that Russia is disseminating disinformation to undermine the POW exchange process. Vladimir Medinsky falsely accused Ukraine of refusing to accept 1,000 POWs and using a "selective approach." The Centre for Countering Disinformation refutes these claims, affirming Ukraine's commitment to an "all-for-all" exchange format. Russia is accused of manipulating public opinion. This aligns with the axiom that deception is a tool of the enemy, as highlighted in John 8:44: "Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it."

results.title: Examining Claims Tulsi Gabbard Said Alleged CIA Plot 'Operation Mockingbird' Never Ended
results.summary: This Snopes article investigates claims that Tulsi Gabbard confirmed the CIA's "Operation Mockingbird" never ended. The article states that Gabbard implied some intelligence operatives leak information to undermine President Trump's agenda, but did not explicitly confirm the existence of a formal CIA program named Operation Mockingbird. The article notes that the CIA has a history of manipulating foreign media, but allegations of widespread manipulation of American press remain unsubstantiated. The article is a secular analysis with no alignment to biblical truth or axioms.

results.title: The Rise of Deepfakes and the Fight for Digital Truth
results.summary: This article discusses the increasing use of deepfakes for misinformation, focusing on a case involving a manipulated video of Nigerian politician Peter Obi. It highlights the dangers of synthetic media, especially in regions with low digital literacy, and calls for regulation, media literacy, and proactive platform moderation. The article warns that "in the age of AI, reality is no longer self-evident," reflecting a broader spiritual battle against deception. Scripture warns, "But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived" (2 Timothy 3:13, KJV).

results.title: Big Little Lies: EU Tackles Disinformation
results.summary: Finland's ambassador to the Philippines discusses EU efforts to combat foreign information manipulation and interference, emphasizing the need for media literacy and digital resilience. The article highlights the hybrid zone of conflict involving cyberattacks and disinformation campaigns, stating, 'calling out false stories and disinformation is essential to maintain not just our democratic values, but our very democracies.' This push for digital sovereignty should be tempered with discernment founded on scriptural truth, lest it become a tool for worldly deception.
